HOUSE BILL No. 1552
_____
DIGEST OF  INTRODUCED B ILL
Citations Affected:  IC 5-10-8-28; IC 27-8-40.2; IC 27-13-7-30.
Synopsis:  Coverage for treatment of chronic diseases. Requires a state
employee health plan, a policy of accident and sickness insurance, and
a health maintenance organization contract to provide coverage for
anti-obesity medication and intensive behavioral and lifestyle therapy.
Effective:  July 1, 2025.
Andrade,  Gore,  Pfaff
January 21, 2025, read first time and referred to Commi ttee on Insurance.

HOUSE BILL No. 1552
A BILL FOR AN ACT to amend the Indiana Code concerning
insurance.
Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Indiana:
1 SECTION 1. IC 5-10-8-28 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA CODE
2 AS A NEW SECTION TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE JULY
3 1, 2025]: Sec. 28. (a) This section applies to a state employee health
4 plan that is established, entered into, amended, or renewed after
5 June 30, 2025.
6 (b) As used in this section, "anti-obesity medication" means
7 medication approved by the federal Food and Drug Administration
8 that is prescribed by a physician to help an individual achieve and
9 maintain a healthy weight.
10 (c) As used in this section, "intensive behavioral and lifestyle
11 therapy" means counseling or treatment that focuses on:
12 (1) changing an individual's lifestyle and behavioral habits;
13 and
14 (2) managing or treating obesity.
15 (d) As used in this section, "physician" means an individual
16 licensed to practice medicine under IC 25-22.5.
17 (e) As used in this section, "state employee health plan" means

9 SECTION 2. IC 27-8-40.2 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA CODE
10 AS A NEW CHAPTER TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
11 JULY 1, 2025]:
12 Chapter 40.2. Coverage for Anti-Obesity Medication and
13 Intensive Behavioral and Lifestyle Therapy
14 Sec. 1. This chapter applies to a policy of accident and sickness
15 insurance that is issued, delivered, amended, or renewed after June
16 30, 2025.
17 Sec. 2. As used in this chapter, "anti-obesity medication" means
18 medication approved by the federal Food and Drug Administration
19 that is prescribed by a physician to help an individual achieve and
20 maintain a healthy weight.
21 Sec. 3. As used in this chapter, "intensive behavioral and
22 lifestyle therapy" means counseling or treatment that focuses on:
23 (1) changing an individual's lifestyle and behavioral habits;
24 and
25 (2) managing or treating obesity.
26 Sec. 4. As used in this chapter, "physician" means an individual
27 licensed to practice medicine under IC 25-22.5.
28 Sec. 5. As used in this chapter, "policy of accident and sickness
29 insurance" has the meaning set forth in IC 27-8-5-1.
30 Sec. 6. A policy of accident and sickness insurance shall provide
31 coverage for:
32 (1) anti-obesity medication; and
33 (2) intensive behavioral and lifestyle therapy.
